This act shall take effect immediately. 18 19 20 STATEMENT 21 22 This bill expressly permits the operation of low-speed electric 23 bicycles in this State. Under the bill, low-speed electric bicycles 24 may be operated on streets, highways, sidewalks, and bicycle paths. 25 An operator of a low-speed electric bicycle is not required to 26 register the low-speed electric bicycle, furnish proof of insurance, 27 or have a driver s license. 28 The bill further provides that all statutes, including the 29 provisions of chapter 4 of Title 39 of the Revised Statutes, rules, 30 and regulations that are applicable to bicycles are to apply to low-
31 speed electric bicycles. 32 The bill defines a low-speed electric bicycle as a two or three-

33 wheeled vehicle with fully operable pedals and an electric motor of 34 less than 750 watts, whose maximum speed on a paved level 35 surface, when powered solely by a motor while operated by a 36 person weighing 170 pounds, is less than 20 miles per hour. 37 The bill also clarifies that the definitions of a motor vehicle, 38 motorcycle, motorized bicycle, and motorized scooter do not 39 include a low-speed electric bicycle. 40
